io.github.reggert.reb4j

Interface Quantifiable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Expression, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractQuantifiableSequenceableAlternative, CharClass, CharLiteral, CharRange, Entity, Group, Intersection, MultiChar, NamedPredefinedClass, Negated, PredefinedClass, SingleChar, Union

    public interface Quantifiable
extends Expression
    Interface implemented by expressions that may have quantifiers applied to them without needing to first be wrapped in parentheses.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Quantified anyTimes()
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated any number of times, using greedy matching.
      Quantified anyTimesPossessively()
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated any number of times, using possessive matching.
      Quantified anyTimesReluctantly()
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated any number of times, using reluctant matching.
      Quantified atLeast(int n)
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated at least the specified minimum number of times, using greedy matching.
      Quantified atLeastOnce()
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated at least once, using greedy matching.
      Quantified atLeastOncePossessively()
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated at least once, using possessive matching.
      Quantified atLeastOnceReluctantly()
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated at least once, using reluctant matching.
      Quantified atLeastPossessively(int n)
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated at least the specified minimum number of times, using possessive matching.
      Quantified atLeastReluctantly(int n)
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated at least the specified minimum number of times, using reluctant matching.
      Quantified optional()
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver appearing once or not at all, using greedy matching.
      Quantified optionalPossessively()
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver appearing once or not at all, using possessive matching.
      Quantified optionalReluctantly()
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver appearing once or not at all, using reluctant matching.
      Quantified repeat(int n)
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated the specified number of times, using greedy matching.
      Quantified repeat(int min, int max)
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated a number of times within the specified range, using greedy matching.
      Quantified repeatPossessively(int n)
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated the specified number of times, using possessive matching.
      Quantified repeatPossessively(int min, int max)
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated a number of times within the specified range, using possessive matching.
      Quantified repeatReluctantly(int n)
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated the specified number of times, using reluctant matching.
      Quantified repeatReluctantly(int min, int max)
      Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated a number of times within the specified range, using reluctant matching.

      • repeat

        Quantified repeat(int n)
        Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated the specified number of times, using greedy matching.
        Parameters:
        n - the exact number of times the pattern must be repeated for the quantified expression to match; must be >= 0.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if n < 0.

      • repeatReluctantly

        Quantified repeatReluctantly(int n)
        Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated the specified number of times, using reluctant matching.
        Parameters:
        n - the exact number of times the pattern must be repeated for the quantified expression to match; must be >= 0.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if n < 0.

      • repeatPossessively

        Quantified repeatPossessively(int n)
        Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated the specified number of times, using possessive matching.
        Parameters:
        n - the exact number of times the pattern must be repeated for the quantified expression to match; must be >= 0.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if n < 0.

      • repeat

        Quantified repeat(int min,
                int max)
        Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated a number of times within the specified range, using greedy matching.
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum number of times that the pattern may be repeated; must be >= 0.
        max - the maximum number of times that the pattern may be repeated; must be >= min.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if min < 0 or max < min.

      • repeatReluctantly

        Quantified repeatReluctantly(int min,
                           int max)
        Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated a number of times within the specified range, using reluctant matching.
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum number of times that the pattern may be repeated; must be >= 0.
        max - the maximum number of times that the pattern may be repeated; must be > 0.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if min < 0 or max < min.

      • repeatPossessively

        Quantified repeatPossessively(int min,
                            int max)
        Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated a number of times within the specified range, using possessive matching.
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum number of times that the pattern may be repeated; must be >= 0.
        max - the maximum number of times that the pattern may be repeated; must be > 0.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if min < 0 or max < min.

      • atLeast

        Quantified atLeast(int n)
        Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated at least the specified minimum number of times, using greedy matching.
        Parameters:
        n - the minimum number of times that the pattern may be repeated; must be be >= 0;
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if n < 0.

      • atLeastReluctantly

        Quantified atLeastReluctantly(int n)
        Returns an expression that matches the receiver repeated at least the specified minimum number of times, using reluctant matching.
        Parameters:
        n - the minimum number of times that the pattern may be repeated; must be be >= 0;
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if n < 0.

      • atLeastPossessively

        Throws:
